intro: Lavoisiera pectinata, commonly known as the pectinate lavoisiera, is a species of flowering plant native to the temperate regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows as an upright herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in dense clusters, making it a distinctive sight in its natural habitat. Lavoisiera pectinata is often found in moist, well-drained soils near streams or in woodland areas.
